meanings.definition: Inclined downward in opposite directions toward a common low point.
meanings.sent1: The synclinal valleys looked like they were leaning down towards the same spot.
meanings.sent2: The geologist pointed out the synclinal rock formations that sloped in different directions.
meanings.sent3: The synclinal hills seemed to be having a race to see who could reach the bottom first.
meanings.sent4: The synclinal arrangement of the shelves in the store made it easy to spot the sale items.
meanings.sent5: The synclinal roof of the house gave it a unique and modern look.

meanings.definition: A downward fold in rock layers.
meanings.sent1: The hikers marveled at the synclinal they discovered in the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the synclinal to understand the geological history of the area.
meanings.sent3: The synclinal in the cliff face looked like a giant wave frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: The layers of rock formed a synclinal that resembled a staircase leading into the earth.
meanings.sent5: The symmetrical synclinal in the canyon walls was a sight to behold.
